availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas A. Ross (Mason County, Kentucky, clerk and bank teller )

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, clerk and bank teller. Mason County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Collins Ross in Mason County, Kentucky on October 15, 1861. Clerk in Mason County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in 1850. Bank teller in Mason County in 1860. Clerk in Mason County in 1861. Clerk in Mason County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 33A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 689.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 331.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Mason County, KY, October 1863, p. 130.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994048, Mason County Marriages.
"Thomas A. Ross (1820-1885)," Find A Grave, Memorial 136095012, accessed March 29, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/136095012.
